message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper deals with computer vision tasks, specifically visual tracking, and proposes an efficient and robust tracking algorithm using a single convolutional neural network (CNN) for learning effective feature representations of the target object in a purely online manner. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also extensively discusses the use of deep learning techniques, specifically CNNs, for feature learning, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel truncated structural loss function and a robust sample selection mechanism, which are related to optimization and learning algorithms, respectively, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another possible category. The paper also evaluates the proposed algorithm on video sequences, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper proposes a lazy yet effective updating scheme for CNN training, which is related to robotics and control, making cs.RO (Robotics) another possible category.
